description: BSD Operating System variant packages, primarily focused on FreeBSD with extensibility for other BSD variants such as OpenBSD, DragonFly BSD. Note: since NetBSD's package manager is designed for cross-platform use, it should use its own dedicated PURL type.

repository.note: The default repository is http://pkg.freebsd.org for FreeBSD. Other BSD variants may use different repositories as appropriate.

namespace_definition.note: The namespace is the BSD variant name such as "freebsd", "openbsd", or "dragonflybsd". It is not case sensitive and must be lowercased.

name_definition.note: The name is the package name and is case sensitive.

version_definition.note: The version is the version of the package.

qualifiers_definition.description: The target architecture for the package.
The BSD release version or distribution variant.
The package epoch number used for version comparison when normal version ordering is insufficient.
